name: Upper External Oblique
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.

2. Let your legs fall to one side, keeping your hips facing upwards towards the ceiling. Try to keep your bottom leg as flat as possible, while letting your top leg relax.

3. Engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine, holding the contraction for a brief moment.

4. Slowly lift your shoulders off the ground and twist your upper body towards the side where your legs are lying. Keep your arms extended along your sides.

5. Lower your shoulder back down to the starting position before repeating on the other side.

6. Perform repetitions by alternating sides, keeping your core muscles engaged throughout the process.
short_summary: The Upper External Oblique exercise targets the obliques and can be performed lying on your back with legs in different positions.
